availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph T. Swetnam (Bath County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary “Polly” Atchison Swetnam in January 1832. Father of Elizabeth A. Swetnam, M. A. Swetnam, John J. Y. Swetnam, William W. Swetnam, Ann E. Swetman, Mary Minerva Swetnam, Charlotte J. Swetnam, Nancy L. Swetnam, Sarah F. Swetnam, and Thomas Swetnam. Appointed lieutenant colonel of the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in 1839. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 256.

Journal of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Frankfort: A. G. Hodges, Public Printer, 1838), 378.
